node.title: Australia Post warns of its busiest Christmas yet as it gears up to handle record parcel demand
node.alt: A postman wears high-vis clothing while delivering mail on an electric bike, brick house in background.
node.description: Australia Post warns this Christmas will be the busiest festive season on record, with parcel volumes surpassing last year's record 52 million.
node.content: ["Australia Post says it will introduce after-dark delivery services and extended trading hours to cope with its busiest Christmas period on record.", "The company said\u00a0parcel demand had increased\u00a0and the volumes in December were\u00a0likely to surpass last year\u2019s record 52 million\u00a0parcels.", "To cope with that demand twilight deliveries have been\u00a0introduced in selected cities like\u00a0Melbourne and Perth.", "It will also extend\u00a0trading hours from November 27 in more than 380 post offices across the country. The\u00a0hours may vary\u00a0by\u00a0retail outlet but will continue until December 23.", "Rod Barnes from\u00a0Australia Post\u00a0said the new services were\u00a0a way to ensure parcels were\u00a0delivered on time.", "\"In the last few weeks, we have recruited almost 300 drivers specifically to hit the roads after hours across Melbourne and Perth,\"\u00a0he said.", "\"We expect our twilight service to help us deliver an additional 25,000 parcels per day in these two cities alone, so if you hear one of our drivers roll up perhaps just as you\u2019re getting home, don\u2019t be surprised.\"", "Mr Barnes said the company had\u00a0also increased its capacity other areas, including chartering extra planes, putting more vehicles on the road, recruiting more than 5,000 new staff, and opening new facilities to manage the volume.\u00a0", "Australia Post recorded 5.7 million households shopping online in October alone, thanks to COVID lockdowns across the country.", "That figure is\u00a0up almost 15 per cent on the previous year.", "However, the industry is facing a\u00a0pre-Christmas parcel delivery crunch, after global delivery giant FedEx locked workers out of its Sydney distribution centre as part of an escalating industrial dispute on Monday.", "Earlier this year, thousands of workers from\u00a0Toll\u00a0and Australia Post's parcel subsidiary StarTrack\u00a0went on strike.", "Those companies have recently\u00a0reached new enterprise bargaining agreements (EBAs) with their workers, bringing an end to strike action.", "FedEx is the last major delivery and logistics firm currently in dispute with the TWU over a new EBA."]
